#Text=Iran :
#Text=Wreckage found of plane crashed in mountains ; all believed dead
#Text=Wednesday , February 21 , 2018
#Text=Aseman Airlines ATR 72 , from file .
#Text=Image : Aeroprints.com .
#Text=( Reuseterms . )

#Text=Yesterday , the Iranian military announced the wreckage of an Aseman Airlines airplane , which went missing on Sunday morning shortly before it was due to land in Yasuj , had been located at an elevation of about 13,000feet ( 4,000m ) in the Zagros Mountains .
#Text=All 65 people on board were presumed dead .
#Text=Crews were searching for the aircraft 's two black boxes to try to determine why it crashed .

#Text=Ramezan Sharif , a spokesman for Iran 's Revolutionary Guards , said wreckage of the ATR 72-500 twin-engine turboprop had been sighted by a military drone and helicopters had then been sent to the location .

#Text=Helicopter pilot Captain Soheili said on state television the wreckage was only some 100feet ( 30m ) from a peak on Mount Dena , and " large parts of the plane , which were labeled with the Aseman company logo " were visible .

column1: #Text=The Revolutionary Guards released photos in which they said bodies of victims could be seen .

#Text=Regional medical center director Ghafoor Rastinrooz told the official IRNA news agency that helicopters were unable to land at the site because of " deep and dangerous crevices in the area of the crash " .

#Text=General Kiumars Heidari , chief of ground forces in the Iranian Army , told the Fars News Agency the dead would have to be brought down the mountain by commandos using specialized ground vehicles .
#Text=The plane took off at about 0430UTC on Sunday from the Iranian capital , Tehran , on Aseman Airlines route EP3704 to Yasuj , in the southwest of the country .

#Text=It vanished from controllers ' radar screens at about 8:52 local time , 0522UTC , and there were reports from people in the area of Samirom , about 14miles ( 22km ) from its destination in Isfahan Province , of seeing it attempting an emergency landing in a pasture and of hearing the crash .
#Text=Hundreds of searchers organized by the Red Crescent and using drones and dogs combed the mountainous terrain but were hampered by windy , foggy conditions and heavy snow .
#Text=The search had to be suspended on Sunday .
#Text=It resumed at dawn on Monday but weather then forced grounding the helicopters .

#Text=At one point on Monday local officials announced searchers had found the wreckage , only to have the national civil aviation agency and the Red Crescent indicate the statement had been premature .
#Text=A demonstration was reported by more than 100people outside a Dena Kooh government office , demanding resignations .
#Text=The plane reportedly had a crew of six — a pilot and a co-pilot , two flight attendants , and two security guards — and 59 passengers , one of them a child .
#Text=A man who recounted missing the flight told the Tabnak news site " God has been really kind to me " , expressing his sadness over those who had died .
#Text=The aircraft was 24 years old .

#Text=Aseman Airlines , Iran 's third largest air carrier and owned by the national civil service pension foundation , said it had been in storage for seven years before recently being placed in operation again .
#Text=Iran 's aircraft are aging and the country has been prevented from buying spare parts by international sanctions imposed in response to its nuclear program .
#Text=Those sanctions were to be lifted under an agreement from 2015 , and Iranian airlines , including Aseman , have ordered new planes from both Airbus and Boeing .
#Text=However , since becoming US President , Donald Trump has declined to recertify the agreement .
#Text=There have been a number of serious Iranian air accidents in modern times .
#Text=In 2011 , at least 77 people died when an Iran Air Boeing 727 crashed during an emergency landing .
#Text=The pilot in the current crash , Captain Hojjatallah Foulad , successfully landed an ATR 72 at the airport in Yasuj in 2013 after one of the engines failed .
